Reviews.Title: “great service.”
Reviews.Author: Anixydi
Reviews.Content: small hotel nothing luxury. great service... it is the mexican motel 8,

Reviews.Title: “Great location...not much else.”
Reviews.Author: KrystinasMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT LOCATION, but other than that needs a major makeover. The girl at the front desk could never be bothered despite their "we're here to serve you" motto. The rooms are dark & drab and the linens definitely need replacing as they have lots of stains. The hallways are kind of creepy at night as the motion light sensors don't always work. the shower stalls are small and with fixed shower heads that can't be adjusted, showering is not the most comfortable experience. Don't waste your time or your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: acaolas
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with a great location. Basic room with basic services. Free internet and free valet parking. Walking distance to great restaurants and parks. Nothing fancy but a simple place to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,close to Angel/U.S. Embassy,fast service,accommodating and can't beat the price.”
Reviews.Author: Jon0311
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I stayed here from 10/13-10/17. We arrived at the hotel at 5:30am and were given a room immediately even though check-in wasn't until 3pm. A 3rd friend met us there as we checked In and the hotel didn't charge us for the extra person even though we only paid for 3 people. The location was good about a 2 blocks from the U.S. embassy and a block from the Angel de Oro. There are some restaurants/bars on the same street as well as a Hooters. The hotel isn't the Ritz but the room was clean and had enough space for 4. Stayed In #801. ask for David the taxi guy to show you around.

Reviews.Title: “This place lost/stolen my cell phone from my room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jolemaysa
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend were on a ten day trip to three places of Mexico including a two-night stay at the Hotel del Angel in Mexico City. After the first night we headed out on day just going to do tourist related stuff. But before we left, we managed to set the do not disturb sign which was provided by the hotel on the outside door handle. I managed to forget my cell phone behind because of all the other stuff we wanted to carry (water, camera, money etc.). So as we came back to the room, we notice our only room key was for some reason deactivated. Once we got it reactivated and eventually went into the room, we noticed the bed was done and the bathroom was restocked. Not only that, my cell phone went missing. We reported it to the front desk and they put very little effort on resolving the issue. The weird thing is, we spoke directly to the female housekeeper that cleaned our room the following day and she said that the manager had told her to clean our room even though she was quite aware that the do not disturb sign was clearly posted in front of the room. It was absolutely hard to even get a hold of the manager and had no sympathy for our lost when we did speak with him. May I also mention that another guest just a couple of doors down over heard our conversation with the housekeeper and spoke with us moments after about getting something stolen from her room. She said that she had 200 pesos taken from her room. If you really wanted to take the risk on staying at this hotel room because of its affordability, make good use of the safe. But to be honest, a cheap hotel room does not outweigh the cost of losing something personal and having your privacy invaded. If you were my friend I would say to look for another place. Its not worth the stress. Its better to have a peace of mind when enjoying such an amazing city. Plus another thing, we did not have running hot water on our second day there till later in the evening. There only solution front desk suggested was to let the water run, which did not do a thing. They also need to repair the cracked tub and sink in the room where we stayed in. These people are shady.

Reviews.Title: “My second home at Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: Edrd
Reviews.Content: After the first time I stayed in this hotel, I knew this will be my favorite in Mexico city. I stay here everytime I go there. It is just one block from the "Angel de la Independencia", the Zona Rosa where the best restaurants are. The service at the hotel is excellent, very clean and big rooms. The prize is SO affordable and everytime I go there, I get free nights, or discounts at their restaurant or upgrades to the suites. This is a small chain of hotels that definitely cares about the customer service. At the corner, there is an OXXO, 1 block from a "farmacia", in the same block there are like 5 nice restaurants, 1 block from Sanborns, so you have almost everything you need for a pleasure or business trip. Try it, you won't regret. PD: The only week point is that there is no fitness room.

Reviews.Title: “Strangely Modern, but I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: mailboxlady
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was VERY helpful and most knew fluent english. We got a tour guide and a car for a day- it was GREAT! The door opened the wrong way in the bathroom, so it was awkward to move around in. The shower had very poor water pressure. Pillows were quite firm...we were given a different room for our 2nd nite, and that too had poor water pressure. Apparently they don't use face cloths in Mexico...just bath and hand towels. Not to USA standards, but for $70 a nite it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheDudeAbides1
Reviews.Content: I was more than a little worried after reading reviews, but this hotel was highly recommended to me for it's price and location, and it did not disappoint! Everyone at the front desk spoke english and the room was clean and neat, if not a little out-dated (the hotel was in the process of renovating the lower floors, including new furniture and hardwood floors). We did encounter a few problems; the sliding glass shower door was off its track and the chain to flush the toilet in the reserve tank had come off, but I fixed both in no time without the notifying management. Our only other complaint about the room was the lack of an alarm clock, but the wake-up calls were reliable. The complimentary breakfast buffet was perfect four our needs; offering 4 dishes (scrambled eggs, chilequiles, refried beans and a rotating potato dish) along with assorted rolls and pastries, cereal, milk, juice and coffee. The location seemed very safe and we walked around at night without a problem. Lots of restaurants and nightlife in the immediate area and the more busy Zona Rosa just a 5 minute walk away. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a great centrally located place to stay to experience Mexico City. If you want to hole-up in your hotel, perhaps you should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disgustingly filthy”
Reviews.Author: cpach
Reviews.Content: My company booked this hotel for me due to its convenient location. The hotel has a middle range price. When I arrived at the hotel I perceived a funny smell at the front desk/bar area but didn't thought too much about it. However, when I got into the room, I could not believe how filthy everything was. It's absolutely disgusting. The room smelled terrible, the carpet was disgusting, the bathroom was totally filthy. There were red stains in the bathtub, the bed linen was not clean. Everything is very old, precarious and ugly but the main point of concern here is cleanliness. It's truly one of the most disgusting hotels I've seen. I advised my company not to use it ever again and I would give everybody the same advise. At the end I had to change hotels because I couldn't stand it. The price is in the middle range but I think the quality is comparable to the worst hotels in the low range so it is definitely overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “The architect that designed it, should sleep over, just one night!”
Reviews.Author: MelPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Very confusing check in! Got a 9th floor room and entered a very strangly modern room. The bath was enclosed in clear glass which afforded no privacy, It had a very heavy sliding glass door that was off the track and only gave a small entry to the bath. There was no enclosure for the shower on the interior, which soaked the toilet paper each time you showered. To use the toilet, your legs were up against the tub. Hot water went off twice in the four times I showered leaving only cold water. You can't adjust the shower head, fastened to the 8ft. ceiling. You have to be under the shower when turning on as the cold water rains down on you, Only comfortable chair in a dark corner near closet. No TV remote in room, you must sign one out at the desk. I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the glass bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: tools_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, sharing a room with a friend. Just as well we are good friends, the walls of the bathroom/toilet are made of frosted glass - you could see everything! That was the only thing I found bad/bizarre about this hotel. The room was clean and tidy, no sign of bugs etc. The shower head was a little clogged so it didn't work great. We did have trouble with the key not opening the door one morning but the staff fixed it straight away. There was a loose plug socket but it seemed safe enough and worked. I agree with others that the photos used are a little misleading - the hotel would have looked great and brand new in the 70's. If you have problems with altitute, the restaurant on the top (11th) floor might not be great for you. Over all I have no complaints, the staff were helpful and the hotel was clean, if in need of a revamp.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is very clean but it is dated. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: x1achilles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a one night layover from Brazil to California. The neighborhood cannot be beat. It is in the center of everything. The area is very safe as is the security at the hotel. I felt completely comfortable walking around the area at night...the sidewalks were crowded with well dressed people going out to one of the many nice restaurants nearby. The room I had on an upper floor was clean, quiet and had all standard amenities. The decor was on the old side. I would put the Del Angel in the same category as a Best Western. The bed was too firm...even more than Brazillian beds. The shower was hot and strong. The bathroom was all marble. I did not have the breakfast as I had a very early morning flight. The Hotel del Angel is a perfectly reasonable choice if you are wishing to save some money. It is not the Marriott at $250. It is a decent, clean, well managed hotel at about $60. Do the complainers about this hotel expect Marriott or Sheraton quality at this price? If the hotel redecorates the rooms, they would be $150/night.

Reviews.Title: “Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: ESLR
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. After reading some of the negative reviews I was expecting the Bates Motel. The room was clean and comfortable and had amenities such as an in-room safe, iron, cable TV, and an air conditioner (a window unit that did a good job cooling the room). The staff was cordial and helpful. The location is perfect, with interesting and lively restaurants nearby. It's a good deal for what you pay. I do not understand the negative comments about the quality of this hotel. If you expect a five-star hotel, then by all means pay $300 a night and stay at the Nikko or the W.

Reviews.Title: “If you can, shop around - otherwise not too bad”
Reviews.Author: CH-made
Reviews.Content: Not too bad for a $60 last-minute booking -- the location is pretty good (on a street with various apparently good restaurants), and you can walk to the "zocolo" in 20-30 minutes (or take a cab). Nevertheless, I would advise you shop around -- I am sure you could get something better. Bathroom was pretty nice with lots of hot water, but the room overall was a bit shabby and breakfast very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Dirty Nasty”
Reviews.Author: reviewNyc
Reviews.Content: Real bad hotel. Spend the extra 10$ for a good hotel. We checked out and checked into a random hotel nearby named "maya land". For 46$ (after bargening) we got a clean hotel in a good location. The staff at the new hotel were very good.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mexcolt
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at this hotel when I go to Mexico City. But. on this trip I found the hotel staff to be a little rude. The incidents were as follows. Friend called one evening and was told that I wasn't there when I was actually in the room waiting for his call. I don't know why she told him that the call was returned to her. Anyway, due to this error, I missed a very important breakfast the next morning. When I checked into the hotel, I asked for two keys to the room and explained to them and introduced them to the person who would be coming for me everyday and told them that the key was that he wouldn't have to wait and come up immediatly when he arrived. Needless to say, he was interrogated by the front desk staff and made to wait anyway. I was quite firm with them when I found out and from there on in, recieved very poor treatment from them. Upon leaving, due to my own error, I failed to check my bill carefully and realized they had charged me for 2 meals at the restaurant that I never ate. I never even visited the restaurant. So, make sure you check your bill carefully before you pay!. I plan to look for new accomodations for my next rip to Mexico City. I can no longer reccomend this hotel to you. The hotel staff ruined the whole stay for me.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel del Angel DON'T EVEN”
Reviews.Author: cctrips2
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while located right near the famous Angel monument, is old, dilapidated and service is poor. First, I got this hotel in a package deal, the same package is found on Site 59, Travelocity and AOL Travel. The room I was given had a balcony to which the sliding glass door did not even lock, one could step right over from the next room's balcony and enter your room easily. Second, the staff is not honest about the un-sealed glass bottles of water that have red caps, that are provided by the hotel in the bathrooms. They claim they contain potable water and can be used for drinking, brushing teeth etc, no restrictions. I became ill twice from this water, discounting that it could be the source of my illness the first time because the front desk staff assured me it was safe. The second time, I became very ill and on top of it, was due to check out in the morning. There are no alarm clocks so I spoke face-to-face with the front desk help to get a wake up call at 6:45am in order to get to the airport for my return flight to the US. I watched the front desk man write 6:45am so I know it had been done. At almost 8am I was awakened by the sun entering my room and called the front desk about my wake up call. They had changed shifts and claimed to know nothing about it. Not only very sick with Montezuma's revenge and now worried about missing my flight, I was furious. This was the worst travelling experience of my entire life.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel....Nasty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel,on Jan 26 thru Jan 30, 2006. The first bedroom was nasty, the sink had pubic hair in it, the shower head fell off when taking a shower. No A/C , Hot & humid. Service was lousy. They move us to another room the next day, No A/C, The TV quit working had to call for another TV. The Toilet quit working.They could do a lot better with service. I would never stay at this Hotel again. from the USA.

Reviews.Title: “If you have nowhere else to go...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel shows three star rating in most pages that sell it and I wonder who and why they are getting this rating. The place is old, not very well kept and even if the housekeeping staff tries hard it doesn't matter because furniture and carpets are too stained to show any success in cleaning. Room Service is not that good, food is okay, but you have to have time to send food once or twice so they can get the correct order. The staff seems nice, but do nothing to rectify any problems brought to their attention. I know some people will think is a language barrier, however, please know I am Spanish so I am very fluent in the language. If you have no other choice I guess you have no other choice, but to me, this hotel is no star and prices way to high for what they have to offer. By the way, I will gladdly recomend the Gran Melia hotel, is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “It was all good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Mexico City the first week of April and were so impressed with the location of this hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff was friendly. The restaurant staff were very nice but after a couple of breakfasts there we ventured out - there are so many wonderful places to eat in the area - right next door in the Hotel Suites Del Angel which has a sidewalk eating area that is so enjoyable. The streets are quaint and tree lined and make dining al fresco a delight. Also there is a Sanborns very closeby (they are on every corner). The Zona Rosa is so close and has many good restaurants. We used hotel taxis and also street taxis. Some of the hotel taxi drivers made us offers to take us to the pyramids and Basilica and we took them up on their offers and had very enjoyable day trips without hassle. The hotel is very close to so many museums that it is very easy to see the city. Strolling on the Paseo de la Reforma is a delight and while you can no longer see the Angel monument from the hotel it is just right there and worth crossing the street to visit and see the spectacular views. The hotel staff was very friendly, everyone from the doormen to the maids were gracious and hospitable. The only "challange" was the air conditioning - my husband had to call every morning to have it turned on, which they did gladly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone as it is so reasonably priced, clean, and the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Thrill, No frills”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Mexico City and stay at Hotel del Angel took place Feb 23-28th. Our plan was to get a cheap hotel that was convenient to shops, restaurants and tourist sites. We weren't expecting any luxury as expected, but were impressed with the prompt cleaning service, maid service, basic ammenities, and very friendly staff. Just take heed of the hotel clerk; he wasn't much help advising us where to go, or how to get around, but don't worry, the staff/doormen take care of that. Make sure you use the red tour bus obtainable a block away that charges a one time fee, and it takes you to all the museums/city sites; you can hop off and get back on that same day as you wish. Next visit the Castle of Chapultepec--a MUST SEE. The anthropology museum was nice, the pyramids of the sun/moon very impressive, and the National folklore dancers are a must see at the Bellas artes theatre. Be wary of taxis. We used private ones the whole trip...pricey but safe. Taxi fare from airport to hotels should only be 15-$20, no more. Enjoy the stay, the food, the tourist venues and visit Taxco if possible for cheap silver jewelry. We will visit again soon...note to travelers...the much bragged about view of the hotel del angel is gone, they are building a huge beast hotel next door that SHADOWS the view!!! Ciao, Chicago travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, close to metro, the major park of the city, and Zona Rosa. The facility was good for the price and rooms were clean. We stayed in this hotel in early September, 2003.

Reviews.Title: “It's a fine fall back if you're really stranded”
Reviews.Author: PoblanoJ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times. I feel safe in the rooms. The street is dark and a little sketchy after dark. The common areas are more than a little drab. The shower knob may occasionally fall off and hit you in the chest with a gushing spray of water and you might get stuck in the elevator between floors, and certainly don't expect the indifferent staff to care too much; in fact, consider it a miracle if you can get as much as a smile out of them when you come and go. Also, life is way too short to waste even one meal at the mediocre restaurant. Having said all that, if you need a room for $50, this place -- which somehow keeps functioning year after year after year - always seems to have rooms available, and it's in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Burning Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I bought a Deluxe room for 3 nights, that is how they advertise and what I got was my feet burn from that water of they bathtub, I complain to that from desk and all they did was send me some cream for burning skin. Two days later I ask to speak to the Manager and he told me he had to check his insurance to se if he can compensate me. Before I check out that manager was no where to be found and finally he call and told is secretary to told me that I can send him my medical bills and he will take care of then. If you thinking of staying in Del angel Hotel I recommend you to try other Hotel and if you choose to stay there, be very careful with that bath water you may get burn. The manager keep saying that was that way that water was supposed to come out. I think he was trying to make me believe it was my fault I got my feet burn. Iam very disappointed with that management and with that Hotel Del Angel "Deluxe".

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: lapintura
Reviews.Content: I have been to Mexico City 5 times in the last few years but this was my first stay at this hotel. It is a modest hotel located near the Zona Rosa with a great view of el Monumento a la Independencia, also known as The Angel. I almost didn't stay there because of the negative reviews. However, I did not experience the problems reported.....my room was prepaid and I had no hassels with my bill; the room had washcloths (sometimes not found in small hotels in Mexico); and hairdryers, etc. were available upon request. I was surprised that their bar (which has an incredible view) was closed on a Saturday night but there are plenty of cantinas nearby. I did not eat in the restaurant so I can't comment on that. There are so many wonderful places to eat in Mexico City that I didn't want to eat in my hotel. I was also surprised to be charged for using the coffee machine in my room as there had been no indication. However, the charge was removed when I inquired about their policy. While the hotel is certainly not fancy by any means, I was comfortable, felt safe as a woman traveling alone and was in a great location for exploring Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well to start off with the service at the hotel was good, meaning the maids, bell boys and the food place where you eat. But the front desk was not so good. They charge me twice for my room which I had to take care of back in the states. There is nothing in the room but a bar. No wash clothes or anything like that. This was not a good time. I would not recommend anyone to go there at all

Reviews.Title: “hated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Starting out first. The bell boys where great and the food was good. But the rest of it was not so good. My wife and I stay for 5 days and we had to book tour through another hotel newby because they would not take credit cards. And then we ask for a taxi and how much it cost to go to a store they stated that it would cost 120 mexico money. At the end it cost about 100 more dollars. The room was not so good. No wash cloths, Hair Dryers, Irons and thing like that. One thing that they said that they had on the internet was pool and golf course. Yes about 20 miles way from the hotel. At check out they said that we have not paid for the room in which we had with a package deal. I then showed them the hotel the paper work and the voucher that was given by the travel agrent. Then hotel stated that they need money and not a travel vocher. I ask them to call they travel agrent that was in the city of mexico and they said they did not have to. Plus when this started they then called the police and had them standing by. I then descide to give them my credit card but they really did not want that. I then sign my name to the credit card and put on the bill that i disagree with this and they would not take it to. They more or less forced me to sign the credit and leave. That is way you pay with credit card so you can come back and have the company take it off of your bill

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Del Angel
HotelInfo.Address: Rio Lerma 154, Col. Cuauauhtemoc, Mexico City 06500, Mexico
